Articles.Content:
I have made a technological discovery in rover design! Make a symmetrical rover (a good way is three iron plates making a line and then put wheels and stuff on it) and stick it atop a rocket.

Finshed? FALSE! You must land it now, so you have two options:

A. Parachutes

B. I'll explain in more detail later.

B is this, use symmetry to mount two liquid fuel boosters on each side of said rover. You may now go and land this as if it was a standard lander.

When did you figure this out? I wouldn't call it a break through, more like an easy way to make a rover that gets to orbit.

Happy Flying

YargJay9991
Dude, I don't want to be the one ruining your ...., but this has been around for at least a year now...

Hmm, not sure if sarcastic or serious...

Yeah, this is really a insignificant "discovery", most people do it already. Sorry.
Still nice of CrazyJebGuy to share, though, you meanies.

Sorry Vanamonde and CrazyJebGuy (cool name btw), I meant to say that but I didn't type it.

Well done on your discovery!

YargJay9991

Wouldn't call it a breakthrough as other people have said. But I still like the idea!

Edited October 31, 2015 by BananaIsAFruit
Capital Letters Man
Not sure if troll or serious, heh.

Still nice of CrazyJebGuy to share, though, you meanies.

This.. there's no need to turn it down. At least he shared it, for those who still don't know this.
